result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Benno Escobedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Benno Escobedo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony Benno Escobedo was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Benno Escobedo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Benno Escobedo appeared by video.  Attorney Anthony D Cotton appeared by video for Anthony Benno Escobedo.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 

AS TO COUNT 2:  On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, Co. Ord. 63.01 to which defendant pled not guilty.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $50.00 including all costs and surcharges by 10/19/2022 or Civil Judgment.

AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed.
Court modified no contact order to NO VIOLENT CONTACT.

Defendant Anthony Benno Escobedo in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court modified no contact order to NO VIOLENT CONTACT. Defense counsel requests an adjournment for defendant to complete programming. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brittany M.E: except as to engage in counseling with the defendant.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony Benno Escobedo in court attorney Olivia G. Garman for attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Bail Bond Hearing in Branch 35. 
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 049080,
Payable Number: 1008529,
Receipt Number: 22RP020954,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 06/15/2022@1p
